title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
પછી પધાર્યા ગઢડે, હરિજનને હેતે હરિ; 
રહી દિન થોડા ઘણા, અમદાવાદ જાવા ઇચ્છા કરી.
gujarati.context: The poor and marginalized people, though treated poorly, still have God's care; they should patiently wait for a few days and then go to Ahmedabad if that is their desire.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
પછી પ્રભુજી પધારિયા, શ્રીનગર સુંદરશ્યામ<RHYME_212368>; 
દેવા દરશન દાસને, પૂરવા હૈયાની હામ<RHYME_212368>.
gujarati.context:
After God's mercy, Shrinagar became beautiful; 
It was meant to be a place of devotion for devotees.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
દાસ સહુ દિવસના, દરશન વિના દુઃખી હતા; 
તેને તે સુખ આપવા, આવ્યા સખા સમીપે શોભતા.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

The slaves were unhappy without seeing their master, and when they saw him, their happiness was restored.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
પુરપતિ રાજી અતિ, નરપતિ આવી નમિયો; 
દાઝ્યાં કુમતિ કુમોદની, જાણી હરિઅર્ક ઉદય થયો.
gujarati.context: The king's will is supreme and the subjects obey; one who knows God's will is awakened to spiritual growth.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
હરિજન મન હુલસ્યાં, જેમ ફૂલ્યાં કમળનાં વન<RHYME_212371>; 
નાથ નયણે નીરખી, અતિ મન થયાં છે મગન<RHYME_212371>.
gujarati.context: The hearts of the marginalized are like lotus flowers that bloom in muddy waters; they have found solace despite being overlooked and neglected. Their minds are pure, untainted by the world's impurities.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
પછી ગાતે વાતે ગામમાં, પ્રભુને પધરાવિયા; 
અવિદ્યા જનને ઉપર્યે, જીત્યના ડંકા વજાવિયા.
gujarati.context: After settling down in the village, one must worship God; and having gained victory, celebrate with joyous dance.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
પાંચ દિવસ પુરમાં, આપે રહ્યા અલબેલ<RHYME_212373>; 
પછી પોત્યે પધારિયા, સંગે સખા લઈ રંગરેલ<RHYME_212373>.
gujarati.context: For five days, you stayed in the city, carefree; then you came back to me with a color and music to share.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
કૈક ચડ્યાં ચોતરે, કૈક ચડ્યાં અગાશી અટારીયે; 
જુવે ઝરૂખા ગોખમાં, કંઈક બેઠાં બારિયે.
gujarati.context: Some people settle in their own place, while others are stuck in someone else's attic; Someone gazes at the world from a distant land, as if sitting on the porch of another's home.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
પડે ધ્રોશ પડઘમ તણી, ઘણી ભીડ્ય ચૌટા ચોકમાં; 
બાલ જોબન વૃદ્ધ વનિતા, બોલે જય જય લોકમાં.
gujarati.context: In life, a person is initially full of energy and enthusiasm, but eventually settles into a calm routine. As they grow older, their words become wisdom sought by many.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
નરનારીયે નાથ નીરખી, લાવો લીધો લોચનનો; 
મીટે મનોહર મૂરતિ, જોઈ પૂર્યો મનોરથ મનનો.
gujarati.context: The couplet suggests that a person should seek their soulmate with patience and not hurry, as the right partner will come when the heart is ready; meanwhile, cherish the beauty of life's journey.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
દાસને દરશન દેતા, ધીરે ધીરે હાલે હરિ; 
સમૂહ જન સનેહશું, નાથ નીર્ખે નયણાં ભરી.
gujarati.context: As a slave surrenders to the divine, slowly and steadily they attain the Lord; similarly, gather people with love, without counting or measuring.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
પછી પોત્યે પધારિયા, પ્રભુજી પુર બારણે; 
અનેક જન જીવન જોઈ, વળી જાય વાલાને વારણે.
gujarati.context: After bearing the weight of life's troubles, one should take a step back and enjoy the fruits of their labor. Many people go through life without realizing it's beauty, until they finally have the chance to appreciate it.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
એમ દઈ દર્શન દાસને, ચાલ્યા દીનદયાળ; 
જન મન રંજન કરવા, હરિ આવિયા વેલાલ્ય.
gujarati.context: The beloved Lord's path is like a river that has flowed away; the devotee's heart is filled with joy and delight.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
અતિ ઉત્સવ કરી જને, પ્રભુ ઘેરે પધરાવિયા; 
ધૂપ દીપ કરી આરતી, ભાવે ભોજન થાળ ધરાવિયા.
gujarati.context: God has adorned life with festivities, and filled the atmosphere with joy; He has lit the lamp of devotion, and provided a feast for the soul.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
રસે ભરી રસોઈ કરી, પછી પરમહંસ જમાડિયા; 
આમ્રફળ હરિ હાથે આપી, મુનિ મોદ પમાડિયા.
gujarati.context: The sweetness of devotion is filled and cooked, afterwards it becomes a precious treasure with the Lord's hand; thus, the devotee's heart is filled with divine joy, given by God.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
પછી ત્યાંથી પધારિયા, આવી કણભે રજની રહ્યા; 
હરિપુર પ્રસાદ લઈ, મેમદાવાદે આવિયા.
gujarati.context:
From there, I returned with a radiant face; 
With Haripura's blessings, we arrived in Ahmedabad.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
દીધાં દર્શન દાસને, દયાળે દિન દોય તિયાં; 
સંતને સુખ આપતા, પછી વાલ્યમ વડથલ ગયા.
gujarati.context: The couplet says that those who have seen God (darsan) will meet Him again, but only in the future; meanwhile, saints bring happiness to people and then return to their divine realm.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
જન મન મગન થયા, નાથ નયણે નીરખી; 
ગાતાં વાતાં ગામમાં, પધરાવિયા હૈયે હરખી.
gujarati.context: A person's thoughts are bound by their mind and body; a true understanding is not possible without spiritual guidance.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
તેને ભુવન ભાવ કરી, હરિ હેતે પધારિયા; 
દાસને દર્શન દઈ, નવલા તે નેહ વધારિયા.
gujarati.context: He has obtained divine love and reached the ultimate truth; The servant has gained a new vision, which has surpassed his previous understanding.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
જને સુંદર ભોજન કરાવી, જમાડ્યા જીવનને; 
પછી સર્વે સંતને, કરાવ્યાં ભોજનને.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes the act of sharing a beautiful meal with others and also nourishing one's own life. After this, all troubles disappear and the feast is enjoyed by all.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
શાક પાક સોયામણાં, આમ્રફળ ઉપર ફરે; 
હરિ મોદક લઈ હાથે, પીરસતાં મનુવાર્ય કરે.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet in English:

Savoring sweet experiences and cherishing moments with loved ones, one's soul finds solace; embracing God's love, we find fulfillment.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
એમ સુખ અતિ ઘણું, આપી સુંદરશ્યામ<RHYME_212368>; 
પછી પ્રભુજી પધારિયા, આવિયા ડડુસર ગામ<RHYME_212368>.
gujarati.context: This couplet describes the joy and beauty of a place, but after being taken over by the ruler's people, it becomes a deserted village. The beauty is lost when power is seized.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
દીધાં દરશન દાસને, જીવન ભવન તેને જઈ<RHYME_212385>; 
નરનારી નાથ નીરખી, કૃતારથ થયાં કંઈ<RHYME_212385>.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes the path of a devotee (dās) who has surrendered their life to God and found spiritual liberation, and how one should observe the beauty of human existence with gratitude.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
એમ આનંદ આપતા, ઉમરેઠમાં હરિ આવિયા; 
બાળ જોબન વૃદ્ધના, મનમાં તે ઘણું ભાવિયા.
gujarati.context: In times of joy and youth, God is near; in old age, one's thoughts are filled with memories.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
સમૈયે વળી સહુ મળી, આવિયાં નર ને નાર્ય<RHYME_212386>; 
ભાવ જોઈ ભવન તેને, પધારિયા મોરાર્ય<RHYME_212386>.
gujarati.context: In times of difficulty, a friend's company is a great comfort; a companion's presence can bring peace to the soul.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
શહેરમાં સંઘ સામ્યો નહિ, પછી ઊતર્યા પુર બારણે; 
ઊંચે આસને બેઠા વાલો, દેવા દરશન કારણે.
gujarati.context: In the city, there is no equality among people; afterwards, one's wealth and status become clear. Those who are seated high look at others with a reason, perhaps due to their devotion to God.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
પછી હરિજને હાથ જોડી, વાલાને વિનતિ કરી; 
ભોજન કરવા ઘેર અમારે, આવિયે આપે હરિ.
gujarati.context: The poor and lowly are helped by the Lord's hand, while those who are rich and powerful are brought down with a sense of humility. The Lord provides for us to eat and live.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
રસોઈ રસ રોટલીની, કરી છે તમ કારણે; 
જમી તમે જન જમાડો, આજ અમારે બારણે.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

"You have created the taste and aroma of your dishes because of you; today, we are feasting with joy."
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
પછી પ્રભુજી પધારિયા, નિજ જન હેતે જમ્યા હરિ; 
સંતને ભોજન કરાવી, ચાલિયા ત્યાંથી ફરી.
gujarati.context: After seeking the Lord's guidance, one should follow their own path; sharing one's experiences with saints and then moving on to new destinations.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
વાટમાં જે ગામ આવે, તેમાં વસે વરણ અઢાર; 
સહુ આવે દર્શને, ભાવે ભર્યાં નરનાર્ય.
gujarati.context: Where the path leads, that's where the traveler settles; when company comes, the heart is filled with joy or sorrow.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
ત્યાંથી શામરખે શ્યામ આવી, રહ્યા હરિ ત્યાં રાત્ય; 
હેતે કરી હરિજનને, બહુ બહુ કરી ત્યાં વાત.
gujarati.context: Shyam, a devotee, arrived at the temple where Lord Hari resides; there, he spent the night in devotion and made many wishes for the lowly people.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
એમ આનંદ આપતા, આવ્યા આણંદ ગામ<RHYME_212368>; 
અસ્વારી સંત સહિત હરિ, ભક્તવત્સલ સુખધામ<RHYME_212368>.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
પુરવાસી હરિજન સરવે, સામાં આવ્યાં નરનાર્ય<RHYME_212389>; 
દર્શન કરી મહારાજનાં, આનંદ પામ્યાં અપાર્ય<RHYME_212389>.
gujarati.context: A low-caste person (Harijan) became a king, and everyone's happiness increased without bounds. Upon seeing the king, immense joy was experienced by all.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
ઢોલ નગારાં વજાડીને, ઘેર પધરાવ્યા ઘનશ્યામ<RHYME_212390>; 
જમાડ્યાં ભોજન ભાવતાં, પૂરણ કર્યાં નિજકામ<RHYME_212390>.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes a simple and contented life, where one's needs are met without excess or extravagance. The speaker seems to have found fulfillment in their own goals and ambitions.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
કેસર ચંદન ભાવ કરી, પૂજિયા પૂરણબ્રહ્મ<RHYME_212391>; 
પુરુષોત્તમ અક્ષરપતિ, કોઈ ન જાણે મર્મ<RHYME_212391>.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the couplet in English:

The Supreme Being has taken the form of a beautiful flower (Kesar Chandan) and has been worshiped as God; only the Omniscient knows the secret (Marm).
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
ભાગ્યવંતે હરિ પૂજિયા, અભાગી રહ્યાં નર વામ<RHYME_212393>; 
ત્યાંથી સંત હરિ હાલિયા, નિર્માની મન અભિરામ<RHYME_212393>.
gujarati.context: Those fortunate to worship Hari are forever blessed; those who don't will remain miserable and vain.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
નિશા વાસ વરતાલ રહી, ગામ ગાને ગોવિંદ આવિયા; 
હેત જોઈ હરિજનનાં, એક રજની ત્યાં રહ્યા.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes a situation where the divine is present in a village and people's karma is revealed; only one person, the Harijan (low-caste), was found to be truly pious.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
બીજે દિન બોચાસણે, આવિયા અવિનાશ; 
ત્યાં નિર્મળ જન નાથનો, તેનું નામ કાશીદાસ.
gujarati.context:
On the day of birth, the soul is unblemished and pure; 
This is described by Kāshīdās, the poet who saw no flaws in it.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
તિયાં પ્રભુજી પધારિયા, દયા કરી દીનદયાળ<RHYME_212394>; 
હરિજન મન હરખી, વળી પૂજિયા તતકાળ<RHYME_212394>.
gujarati.context: The Lord has descended upon the lowly, and by His mercy, He has lifted up the downtrodden. The oppressed have found solace in Him, and at just the right moment, they have been worshiped.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
ધૂપ દીપ કરી આરતી, અતિ ભાવે ભૂધર જમાડિયા; 
પલંગ સુંદર પાથરી, પળ એક પ્રભુને પોઢાડિયા.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes a peaceful and serene atmosphere where the scent of incense (dhup) and the light of a lamp (dip) fill the air, making one's heart joyful and grateful to God. The beauty of nature (palki) is praised as it reflects the divine will of the Lord (Prabhu).
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
પછી મુનિજનને, જમાડવા પંગત્ય કરી; 
પરમહંસને પીરસવા, ત્યાં આવિયા આપે હરિ.
gujarati.context: After seeking the munis' guidance, I was led to where Paramhansa resides; and there, Hari granted me what I asked for.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
સંત જમાડી શ્યામળે, પછી સર્વે ને શીખ કરી; 
પોતે પધાર્યા પાંચાળમાં, એમ આપી સુખ શ્રીહરિ.
gujarati.context: The saintly Shyamal, having understood everything, has taught everyone the lesson of happiness. He himself dwelled in the five villages and gave people joy and prosperity under His Lordship Sri Hari.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
પવિત્ર કરવા પૃથિવી, એમ ફરે સુંદરશ્યામ<RHYME_212368>; 
જે જે જને નીરખ્યા, તે થયાં પૂરણકામ<RHYME_212368>.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet in English:

The earth is made sacred by beautiful deeds; whatever one has done will be accomplished in its entirety.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
ધન્ય ધન્ય એ દેશ ગામને, ધન્ય સર સરિતા વન<RHYME_212371>; 
ધન્ય એ વાપી કૂપને, જેનાં જળ પીવે જીવન<RHYME_212371>.
gujarati.context: The country or village is blessed when its people are grateful and pure of heart. Gratitude is like a well that quenches the thirst of life, bringing blessings and sustenance.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
ધન્ય ભુવન એ જનનાં, જ્યાં પ્રભુનાં પગલાં થયાં; 
સત્ય વૈકુંઠ સરખાં, વળી કેમ કરી જાય કહ્યાં.
gujarati.context: The blessed life is where one follows the path of God; truth and heaven are always in sync, and it's known that one can achieve this with faith.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
જિયાં જિયાં હરિ વિચર્યા, તિયાં પાપી કોઈ પ્રાણ તજે; 
તે જાય નહિ જમપુરમાં, રહે નહિ પાપ રજે.
gujarati.context: God is everywhere and observes everything, and only the wicked will ultimately suffer; their evil deeds will not go unpunished, even in Jamapur.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
એવી એ મોટી વારતા, પ્રાકૃત નર પ્રીછે નઈ<RHYME_212399>; 
સમઝે સંત શિરોમણિ, જેની અપ્રાકૃત દ્રષ્ટિ થઈ<RHYME_212399>.
gujarati.context: A great war is fought with unrefined strength, but the wise saint sees with an unwavering vision. The one who understands sees with a divine perspective.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
નિત્યે ચરિત્ર નાથનાં, જે સાંભળશે શ્રદ્ધા કરી; 
તે નર કાળની જાળ માંઈ, પડે નહિ પાછો ફરી.
gujarati.context: Each day is a test of character, which should be performed with faith; that person will not be trapped in the web of time and will not look back with regret.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
પતિતને પાવન કરવા, ચરિત્ર છે ભગવાનનાં; 
સાંભળતાં સદ્ય શુદ્ધ થાય, જાય પાપ તે જનનાં.
gujarati.context: One's character is a gift from God, and it's what makes one pure; as one practices self-control, sin leaves them, just like yesterday's impurities are washed away.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
વારમવાર વિસ્તાર કરી, ગાશે ગુણ ગોવિંદના; 
તે જન સર્વે દુઃખ વામશે, પામશે દન આનંદના.
gujarati.context: As the cycle of life repeats itself, one's virtues are praised by God; subsequently, everyone in the world experiences suffering, but also finds happiness through inner joy.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
હરિજન મન હુલસી, સુણી ચરિત્ર સુધારસ સાર<RHYME_212401>; 
અજ્ઞાનીને અભાવ થાય, લાગે સુમલખાર<RHYME_212401>.
gujarati.context: The humble-hearted person improves their character with good deeds; for the ignorant, it seems like a distant dream.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
એમ સહુને સુખ આપ્યાં, જ્યેઠ સુદિ નવમીને દને; 
એટલી લીલા કરી હરિ, આવ્યા ઉત્તમને ભુવને.
gujarati.context: God has given him happiness in his old age, as he has completed the auspicious ninth phase of life; He has played a playful game with the best of the best, bringing them to the realm of ultimate bliss.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 82: Shrī Haricharitre Shrī Hari Gaḍhaḍe Padhāryā

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī padhāryā Gaḍhaḍe, harijanne hete Hari; <RHYME_1>
Rahī din thoḍā ghaṇā, Amadāvād jāvā ichchhā karī.  <RHYME_1>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the joy of reunion with a loved one, comparing it to the sweetness of a ripe mango. The speaker longs to be together with that person, even if it takes all day and night to make it happen.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī Prabhujī padhāriyā, Shrīnagar sundarshyām; <RHYME_2>
Devā darashan dāsne, pūravā haiyānī hām.  <RHYME_2>
transliteration.context: The Lord has taken me to the beautiful Shrinagar, where I've gained divine vision. My heart is now filled with longing for the spiritual realm.

transliteration.couplet:
Dās sahu divasnā, darashan vinā dukhī hatā; <RHYME_3>
Tene te sukh āpavā, āvyā sakhā samīpe shobhatā.  <RHYME_3>
transliteration.context: One's happiness is destroyed without seeing one's beloved, and it's a great suffering. Happiness arises when one meets their loved ones and they are together.

transliteration.couplet:
Purpati rājī ati, narpati āvī namiyo; <RHYME_4>
Dāzyā kumati kumodanī, jāṇī Hari-ark uday thayo.  <RHYME_4>
transliteration.context: The wise and just king is the best, while a foolish commoner may be great in name only. A person with little intelligence is not worthy of being called intelligent, even if they have good knowledge of God.

transliteration.couplet:
Harijan man hulasyā, jem fūlyā kamaḷnā van; <RHYME_5>
Nāth nayaṇe nīrakhī, ati man thayā chhe magan.  <RHYME_5>
transliteration.context: A person's worth is not measured by their birth or social status, for true beauty lies within. True greatness is found in one's good deeds and noble character.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī gāte vāte gāmmā, Prabhune padharāviyā; <RHYME_6>
Avidyā janne uparye, jītyanā ḍankā vajāviyā.  <RHYME_6>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the journey of a soul to God, where it seeks refuge and redemption from ignorance. Ultimately, the soul finds liberation through devotion and spiritual understanding.

transliteration.couplet:
Pāch divas purmā, āpe rahyā Alabel; <RHYME_7>
Pachhī potye padhāriyā, sange sakhā laī rangrel.  <RHYME_7>
transliteration.context: Seven days have passed, and the beloved is here with me. We've spent time together, enjoying each other's company.

transliteration.couplet:
Kaik chaḍyā chotare, kaik chaḍyā agāshī aṭārīye; <RHYME_8>
Juve zarūkhā gokhmā, kaīk beṭhā bāriye.  <RHYME_8>
transliteration.context:
Here is the summary:

This couplet highlights the contrast between a child's small steps and a grown-up's long strides, emphasizing how our paths change over time. The speaker notes that just as children take small steps, adults make bigger leaps forward in life.

transliteration.couplet:
Paḍe dhrosh paḍgham taṇī, ghaṇī bhīḍya chauṭā chokmā; <RHYME_9>
Bāl joban vṛuddha vanitā, bole jay jay lokmā.  <RHYME_9>
transliteration.context: A young woman is eager to marry and settle down, but fate has other plans for her. Her words of "Jay Jay Lokma" are a futile attempt to speed up the process.

transliteration.couplet:
Nar-nārīye Nāth nīrakhī, lāvo līdho lochanno; <RHYME_10>
Mīṭe manohar mūrati, joī pūryo manorath manno.  <RHYME_10>
transliteration.context: A person's true nature is revealed when they are in distress, and their beautiful appearance fades away like a lotus flower in water. In difficult times, one's true intentions and desires are exposed.

transliteration.couplet:
Dāsne darashan detā, dhīre dhīre hāle Hari; <RHYME_11>
Samūh jan sanehshu, Nāth nīrkhe nayaṇā bharī.  <RHYME_11>
transliteration.context: As one's devotion increases slowly, Lord Hari is revealed gradually; when the assembly of devotees is pure and sincere, God's presence fills their hearts abundantly.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī potye padhāriyā, Prabhujī pur bāraṇe; <RHYME_12>
Anek jan jīvan joī, vaḷī jāy vālāne vāraṇe.  <RHYME_12>
transliteration.context: The phrase describes a person who has achieved spiritual growth and is now wandering freely with the Lord's guidance. Many souls have attained liberation in their lifetime, just as many travelers cross rivers successfully.

transliteration.couplet:
Em daī darshan dāsne, chālyā dīndayāḷ; <RHYME_13>
Jan man ranjan karavā, Hari āviyā velālya.  <RHYME_13>
transliteration.context: Meeting the Lord is like a rare opportunity that doesn't come often; one must make the most of it while they can. Make the most of this lifetime and fill your heart with devotion to God.

transliteration.couplet:
Ati utsav karī jane, Prabhu ghere padharāviyā; <RHYME_14>
Dhūp dīp karī āratī, bhāve bhojan thāḷ dharāviyā.  <RHYME_14>
transliteration.context: The divine festival is celebrated with great enthusiasm and the Lord's presence is felt; the aroma of incense and lamps fills the air, and the feast of love is served.

transliteration.couplet:
Rase bharī rasoī karī, pachhī paramhansa jamāḍiyā; <RHYME_15>
Āmrafaḷ Hari hāthe āpī, muni mod pamāḍiyā.  <RHYME_15>
transliteration.context:
The couplet describes a seeker's journey to self-realization, where they traverse the cycles of birth and death until finally achieving spiritual liberation.

The speaker attributes this ultimate freedom to their devotion to God, saying it has brought them great joy and contentment.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī tyāthī padhāriyā, āvī kaṇabhe rajanī rahyā; <RHYME_16>
Haripur prasād laī, Memdāvāde āviyā.  <RHYME_16>
transliteration.context: A bride's beauty is like the evening sky, radiant and bright. She has returned from Haripur with blessings and has arrived in Memdāvāde.

transliteration.couplet:
Dīdhā darshan dāsne, dayāḷe din doy tiyā; <RHYME_17>
Santne sukh āpatā, pachhī vālyam Vaḍathal gayā.  <RHYME_17>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the joy of meeting a kind and compassionate person (dayāḷe) as it brings peace and happiness to one's soul. This encounter is like finding an oasis in the desert, where all worries are washed away.

transliteration.couplet:
Jan man magan thayā, Nāth nayaṇe nīrakhī; <RHYME_18>
Gātā vātā gāmmā, padharāviyā haiye harakhī.  <RHYME_18>
transliteration.context: The couplet expresses the joy of being with a loved one, where every moment is cherished and appreciated. The poem highlights the beauty of togetherness in nature, bringing harmony to both body and soul.

transliteration.couplet:
Tene bhuvan bhāv karī, Hari hete padhāriyā; <RHYME_19>
Dāsne darshan daī, navalā te neh vadhāriyā.  <RHYME_19>
transliteration.context: In God's world, one should always behave with devotion and humility; only then will God's divine sight be bestowed upon us.

transliteration.couplet:
Jane sundar bhojan karāvī, jamāḍyā jīvanne; <RHYME_20>
Pachhī sarve santne, karāvyā bhojanne.  <RHYME_20>
transliteration.context: A beautiful meal is prepared with love, and a life filled with joy; afterwards, all worries are gone and the meal is savored.

transliteration.couplet:
Shāk pāk soyāmaṇā, āmrafaḷ upar fare; <RHYME_21>
Hari modak laī hāthe, pīrasatā manuvārya kare.  <RHYME_21>
transliteration.context: We're not sure what's ripe, and we're not sure what's in store; Just like the Lord's sweet treat, we take things as they come.

transliteration.couplet:
Em sukh ati ghaṇu, āpī sundarshyām; <RHYME_22>
Pachhī Prabhujī padhāriyā, āviyā Ḍaḍusar gām.  <RHYME_22>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes a peaceful and beautiful evening where the sun sets slowly behind the hills of Dhadusar village, as if following the instructions of the divine.

transliteration.couplet:
Dīdhā darashan dāsne, jīvan bhavan tene jaī; <RHYME_23>
Nar-nārī Nāth nīrakhī, kṛutārath thayā kaī.  <RHYME_23>
transliteration.context: A person's life is built with the steps they take, and their destination is revealed by their actions. The fate of a man and woman is shaped by their choices and deeds.

transliteration.couplet:
Em ānand āpatā, Umreṭhmā Hari āviyā; <RHYME_24>
Bāḷ joban vṛuddhanā, manmā te ghaṇu bhāviyā.  <RHYME_24>
transliteration.context: In eternal joy, the devotee is united with God; a young person becomes old and their mind becomes grave.

transliteration.couplet:
Samaiye vaḷī sahu maḷī, āviyā nar ne nārya; <RHYME_25>
Bhāv joī bhavan tene, padhāriyā morārya.  <RHYME_25>
transliteration.context:
A loving couple's heart is one in joy and sorrow, sharing all with each other.
Their life's journey is together, through happiness and sadness.

transliteration.couplet:
Shahermā sangha sāmyo nahi, pachhī ūtaryā pur bāraṇe; <RHYME_26>
Ūche āsane beṭhā vālo, devā darashan kāraṇe.  <RHYME_26>
transliteration.context: In this Gujarati couplet, the speaker says that a group of people is not like a tree with similar leaves, as everyone has their own unique journey and experiences. The gathering of people is only to have a glimpse of God or a higher power.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī harijane hāth joḍī, vālāne vinati karī; <RHYME_27>
Bhojan karavā gher amāre, āviye āpe Hari.  <RHYME_27>
transliteration.context: The couplet expresses the desire to be grateful and submissive to God's will, no matter what circumstances one faces. It emphasizes the importance of having faith in God and seeking guidance through Him.

transliteration.couplet:
Rasoī ras roṭalīnī, karī chhe tam kāraṇe; <RHYME_28>
Jamī tame jan jamāḍo, āj amāre bāraṇe.  <RHYME_28>
transliteration.context: The joys of love are like the rhythm of music, and the reason is in my beloved's presence. Tonight, I'm completely yours, just as I'm already under your control.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī Prabhujī padhāriyā, nij jan hete jamyā Hari; <RHYME_29>
Santne bhojan karāvī, chāliyā tyāthī farī.  <RHYME_29>
transliteration.context: The Lord's path is followed with great devotion and one's own people are served with love. All worries disappear after having a meal with saints.

transliteration.couplet:
Vāṭmā je gām āve, temā vase varaṇ aḍhār; <RHYME_30>
Sahu āve darshane, bhāve bharyā nar-nārya.  <RHYME_30>
transliteration.context: In a stranger's home, one finds temporary peace; In the eyes of a loved one, eternal happiness is found.

transliteration.couplet:
Tyāthī Shāmarkhe shyām āvī, rahyā Hari tyā rātya; <RHYME_31>
Hete karī harijanne, bahu bahu karī tyā vāt.  <RHYME_31>
transliteration.context: Lord Krishna has come to Shama's home at night, and Lord Hari has arrived as well. Many have gathered to see the wind of love blow through this place.

transliteration.couplet:
Em ānand āpatā, āvyā Āṇand gām; <RHYME_32>
Aswārī sant sahit Hari, bhaktavatsal sukhdhām.  <RHYME_32>
transliteration.context:
In blissful ecstasy, I've reached the ultimate destination;
With God, I've found eternal peace and happiness.

transliteration.couplet:
Purvāsī harijan sarave, sāmā āvyā nar-nārya; <RHYME_33>
Darshan karī Mahārājnā, ānand pāmyā apārya.  <RHYME_33>
transliteration.context: All souls are equal in the presence of God, rich or poor; Seeing the king of kings fills us with immense joy and happiness.

transliteration.couplet:
Ḍhol nagārā vajāḍīne, gher padharāvyā Ghanshyām; <RHYME_34>
Jamāḍyā bhojan bhāvatā, pūraṇ karyā nijkām.  <RHYME_34>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summarization of the Gujarati couplet:

Ghanshyam's home has been prepared with great enthusiasm, and his feast will be abundant.

transliteration.couplet:
Kesar chandan bhāv karī, pūjiyā pūraṇbrahma; <RHYME_35>
Puruṣhottam Akṣharpati, koī na jāṇe marma.  <RHYME_35>
transliteration.context: The couplet compares the love between two people to a blend of saffron and sandalwood, worshiping God in each other's presence. It also suggests that the depth of this love is so profound that it's hard for others to understand its essence.

transliteration.couplet:
Bhāgyavante Hari pūjiyā, abhāgī rahyā nar vām; <RHYME_36>
Tyāthī sant Hari hāliyā, nirmānī man abhirām.  <RHYME_36>
transliteration.context: The god Hari (Vishnu) is praised by those who are fortunate and remain steadfast, while the unfortunate one wanders away; when the saintly Hari's mercy descends, the mind becomes tranquil and peaceful.

transliteration.couplet:
Nishā vās Varatāl rahī, gām Gāne Govind āviyā; <RHYME_37>
Het joī harijannā, ek rajanī tyā rahyā.  <RHYME_37>
transliteration.context: The divine play unfolds in the evening, with Lord Govind arriving at the village's Gām (gathering). In this joyous celebration, a single moonlight shines forth.

transliteration.couplet:
Bīje din Bochāsaṇe, āviyā Avināsh; <RHYME_38>
Tyā nirmaḷ jan Nāthno, tenu nām Kāshīdās.  <RHYME_38>
transliteration.context: The couplet expresses the idea that a life of simplicity and humility (Bīje din) is superior to one of opulence and showiness (Bochāsaṇe). It attributes this wisdom to Avināsh, with Nāthno and Kāshīdās likely referring to the speaker or a revered figure.

transliteration.couplet:
Tiyā Prabhujī padhāriyā, dayā karī dīndayāḷ; <RHYME_39>
Harijan man harakhī, vaḷī pūjiyā tatkāḷ.  <RHYME_39>
transliteration.context: The Lord's mercy is abundant and compassionate towards the lowly; He looks upon the devotee with loving eyes.

transliteration.couplet:
Dhūp dīp karī āratī, ati bhāve bhūdhar jamāḍiyā; <RHYME_40>
Palang sundar pātharī, paḷ ek Prabhune poḍhāḍiyā.  <RHYME_40>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes a beautiful lamp (āratī) and a precious stone (pātharī), both of which are pleasing to God. The speaker is seeking the Lord's blessing through their offerings and devotion.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī munijanne, jamāḍavā pangatya karī; <RHYME_41>
Paramhansane pīrasavā, tyā āviyā āpe Hari.  <RHYME_41>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the innocence of a child who is pure and free from worldly desires, like a flower that blooms in its natural state. The second line suggests that even a great saint can be affected by worldly attachments, unlike God, who remains untouched by such influences.

transliteration.couplet:
Sant jamāḍī Shyāmaḷe, pachhī sarve ne shīkh karī; <RHYME_42>
Pote padhāryā Pānchāḷmā, em āpī sukh Shrī Hari.  <RHYME_42>
transliteration.context: When one is surrounded by suffering, everyone else seems to be at peace; but the true seeker of spiritual bliss finds joy in devotion to Lord Sri Hari.

transliteration.couplet:
Pavitra karavā pṛuthivī, em fare sundarshyām; <RHYME_43>
Je je jane nīrakhyā, te thayā pūraṇkām.  <RHYME_43>
transliteration.context: The pure earth is the abode of beauty, where even the ugly ones become beautiful. In this world, those who are pure and humble become complete.

transliteration.couplet:
Dhanya dhanya e desh gāmne, dhanya sar saritā van; <RHYME_44>
Dhanya e vāpī kūpne, jenā jaḷ pīve jīvan.  <RHYME_44>
transliteration.context: This Gujarati couplet celebrates the beauty of nature and its abundance, describing a land where rivers flow with gratitude and the earth is nourished by the rain. It also praises the life-giving qualities of water, which quenches the thirst of all living beings.

transliteration.couplet:
Dhanya bhuvan e jannā, jyā Prabhunā pagalā thayā; <RHYME_45>
Satya Vaikunṭh sarakhā, vaḷī kem karī jāy kahyā.  <RHYME_45>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the joy of being a devotee, who has become crazy with love for God, and is eager to reach the heavenly abode. It asks what more can be done to attain the ultimate truth, which is the abode of Lord Vishnu.

transliteration.couplet:
Jiyā jiyā Hari vicharyā, tiyā pāpī koī prāṇ taje; <RHYME_46>
Te jāy nahi Jampurmā, rahe nahi pāp raje.  <RHYME_46>
transliteration.context: As one remembers God's love (Hari), their sinful nature (prāṇ) exhausts; the wicked don't survive in Jam-Pur (a place of suffering). The sinner doesn't depart, nor does sin reign supreme.

transliteration.couplet:
Evī e moṭī vāratā, prākṛut nar prīchhe naī; <RHYME_47>
Samaze sant shiromaṇi, jenī aprākṛut draṣhṭi thaī.  <RHYME_47>
transliteration.context: Nature's beauty is not appreciated by ordinary people; only the wise and understanding can truly appreciate it.

transliteration.couplet:
Nitye charitra Nāthnā, je sāmbhaḷshe shraddhā karī; <RHYME_48>
Te nar kāḷnī jāḷ māī, paḍe nahi pāchho farī.  <RHYME_48>
transliteration.context: One who has a stable character and faith, will not fall into the trap of others' false words. Their own wisdom will be their guide, which cannot be surpassed by anyone else's.

transliteration.couplet:
Patitne pāvan karavā, charitra chhe Bhagwānnā; <RHYME_49>
Sāmbhaḷatā sadya shuddha thāy, jāy pāp te jannā.  <RHYME_49>
transliteration.context: One is purified by righteous deeds, and God is pleased with one's character. Sinners will face punishment in the next life.

transliteration.couplet:
Vāramvār vistār karī, gāshe guṇ Govindnā; <RHYME_50>
Te jan sarve dukh vāmashe, pāmashe dan ānandnā.  <RHYME_50>
transliteration.context: As the soul expands and unfolds, it sings praises of God's qualities; all worries and pains disappear, and joy and bliss are gained.

transliteration.couplet:
Harijan man hulasī, suṇī charitra sudhāras sār; <RHYME_51>
Agnānīne abhāv thāy, lāge sumalkhār.  <RHYME_51>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet in English:

The essence of a virtuous person's story is their kindness and humility; without knowledge, one remains incomplete.

transliteration.couplet:
Em sahune sukh āpyā, Jyeṭh sudi navmīne dane; <RHYME_52>
Eṭalī līlā karī Hari, āvyā Uttamne bhuvane.  <RHYME_52>
transliteration.context: In a peaceful home, one finds happiness too, and in good times, sharing is the right thing to do.
